p: Though the triterpenoid lupeol has shown weak antiviral activities in several studies, lupeol isolated from Strobilanthes cusia root has demonstrated a robust anti-HSV activity in vitro ( Flekhter et al., 2004). It has therefore, served as a lead drug for the generation of more effective compounds against HSV and Influenza A (Zheng et al., 2009). In line with its antiviral activities, we showed the moderate anti-HBV potential of lupeol in vitro. In our in silico analysis, lupeol interacted with HBV Pol through Trp3, Pro5, Leu42 and Arg120, His156 and Tyr158, and stabilized the lupeol-Pol complex with a free energy −8.1 kcal/mol.
